body:
This seems like it might be a bug in electron. The `__dirname` variable is explicitly documented as referring to the full path of the directory containing the current module file.

Are you actually running this in the node 8.4.0 runtime? Is python involved here at all? What version of electron are you using?

Yes I think it is a bug in electron or something in my webpack config.
For electron, I have a special webpack config where I see:
```
    node: {
        __dirname: false,
        __filename: false,
    },
```
I have seen this issue: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/1599.
Do not really know if it's related.
I copy/pasted the webpack config from a bootstrap config for running electron.

Any thoughts?

EDIT: python is not related, but it was in the issue template, so I put it in case.
Yes I run this with node 8.4.0 runtime with babel from a webpack config.
Using electron 1.7.9

Ok just figured out what is going on.
It's all about webpack and externals for backend node application.
This issue helped me a lot: https://github.com/chentsulin/electron-react-boilerplate/issues/1#issuecomment-107224692

The problem is that `grpc` dependency needed to be in my externals for webpack to work with, and __dirname being correct.

Got back to 
```javascript
externals: ['grpc'],
node: {
        __dirname: false,
        __filename: false,
    },
```
And it worked great!

The only problem now is here in `grpc_extension.js`:
```javascript
var binary = require('node-pre-gyp/lib/pre-binding');
var path = require('path');
console.log(__dirname);
var binding_path = binary.find(path.resolve(path.join(__dirname, '../../../package.json')));
var binding = require(binding_path);
```

On the last line, the binding_path is:  `"/home/{linux_user}/Projects/{my_project}/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/electron-v1.7-linux-x64/grpc_node.node"`

This path does not exist. The folder `electron-v1.7-linux-x64` does not exist, in fact I have a folder named `node-v57-linux-x64`


As this issue is now solved from its initial problem, could someone point me in the right direction for understanding what is going on now?
Thank you very much for your time, and sorry for all this displayed investigation. Hope it will help others.

Ok, as far as I understand, I need to build the binary myself as described here:
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/10458
and here https://electron.atom.io/docs/tutorial/using-native-node-modules/

Si I've setup:
```
export npm_config_target=v1.7.9
export npm_config_runtime=electron
```

This is what I get:
```
> grpc@1.6.7 install /home/{user}/Projects/{project}src/electron/node_modules/grpc
> node-pre-gyp install --fallback-to-build --library=static_library

node-pre-gyp ERR! Tried to download(403): https://storage.googleapis.com/grpc-precompiled-binaries/node/grpc/v1.6.7/electron-v1.7-linux-x64.tar.gz 
node-pre-gyp ERR! Pre-built binaries not found for grpc@1.6.7 and electron@1.7.9 (electron-v1.7 ABI) (falling back to source compile with node-gyp)

gyp ERR! stack     at emitOne (events.js:120:20)
gyp ERR! stack     at Request.emit (events.js:210:7)

node-pre-gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (/home/guillaume/Projects/morpheo/morpheo-analytics/src/electron/node_modules/node-pre-gyp/lib/util/compile.js:83:29)

Failed to execute '/usr/local/bin/node /home/guillaume/Projects/morpheo/morpheo-analytics/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js configure --fallback-to-build --library=static_library --module=/home/guillaume/Projects/morpheo/morpheo-analytics/src/electron/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/electron-v1.7-linux-x64/grpc_node.node --module_name=grpc_node --module_path=/home/guillaume/Projects/morpheo/morpheo-analytics/src/electron/node_modules/grpc/src/node/extension_binary/electron-v1.7-linux-x64' (1)

npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /home/guillaume/.npm/_logs/2017-10-19T17_39_55_305Z-debug.log
```

Looks like now a grpc  issue again xD
What am I missing?

Ok just succeeded to build the right binary in the right folder, just exported all the variables:
```
# Electron's version.
export npm_config_target=1.7.9
# The architecture of Electron, can be ia32 or x64.
export npm_config_arch=x64
export npm_config_target_arch=x64
# Download headers for Electron.
export npm_config_disturl=https://atom.io/download/electron
# Tell node-pre-gyp that we are building for Electron.
export npm_config_runtime=electron
# Tell node-pre-gyp to build module from source code.
export npm_config_build_from_source=true
```

Ok last and hope least. There is one last issue...
When running my webpack config for launching the electron app, nothing is launched...
Everything seems to work correctly, I have no errors, but the app is not launched...
Like `grpc` is blocking the electron app.
I have no trace, no error.

Anybody have been in this case before?
Sorry for digressing a lot in this issue. But I think it will be helpful to describe each step for others.

I would like to note that with the variables you mentioned exporting, you can actually omit the last one (`export npm_config_build_from_source=true`). If you do, it will attempt to install the precompiled `grpc_node.node` that we distribute.
